title: RSS barred in K'taka? Cabinet approves new rules; no activities allowed in public places
content: Karnataka's cabinet has decided to introduce new regulations for Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh activities, including marches and events on government property and public roads.  Information Technology Minister Priyank Kharge stated that permission will be required for such gatherings, emphasizing that organizations cannot operate freely in public spaces. These rules aim to regulate public demonstrations and maintain order.

title: 'Insufficient evidence': US appeals court blocks Trump's request to send National Guard to Chicago
content: A US appeals court has blocked President Trump's order to deploy the National Guard in Chicago, citing a lack of evidence for rebellion or danger. The court found that protests against immigration policies, even if spirited, do not justify such a deployment. This ruling follows similar challenges from Illinois, Oregon, and California against the administration's use of federal troops domestically.

title: Trump's claim on Russian crude oil: Will India stop buying it? Here's what's happening
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs denied knowledge of a call where PM Modi allegedly assured US President Trump of stopping Russian crude purchases. While India diversifies energy sources, driven by market economics and reduced Russian discounts, it also signals potential for increased oil imports from the US.

title: A failed strike and then a 6-day conflict: Meet Mehsud - man who brought Pak to its knees
content: An airstrike targeting TTP leader Noor Wali Mehsud in Kabul failed, intensifying border clashes between Pakistan and Afghanistan. Mehsud, credited with rebuilding the TTP, has shifted tactics to target the Pakistani army, fueling a renewed insurgency from his sanctuary in Afghanistan.

title: ‚ÄòWe need rare earths‚Äô: Anduril CEO says US 'too reliant' on China; calls for action
content: Anduril Industries founder Palmer Luckey warned that the US defense supply chain is overly dependent on China, urging reindustrialization and domestic production of critical components like rare earths and chips. CEO Brian Schimpf anticipates a long-term conflict with China, a sentiment echoed by Palantir CTO Shyam Sankar, who highlighted decades of brewing tensions and China's impact on American prosperity.

title: MacKenzie Scott cuts Amazon stake by 42%; now holds $12.6bn; prioritises equity work
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, cutting holdings by nearly 42% to $12.6 billion. This reduction occurred despite Amazon's stock performance and follows her extensive philanthropic efforts, which have heavily focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. The exact reasons for the stake reduction, whether sales or donations, remain unspecified.

title: Introspection mode: Zoho founder to take break; warns of this risk
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches. He aims to complete crucial product development, including end-to-end encryption for Zoho's Arattai messaging app, a feature designed to enhance user data privacy by storing information solely on devices.

title: Josh Allen opens up: Life lessons from wife Hailee Steinfeld beyond football
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen revealed his marriage to Hailee Steinfeld has profoundly impacted his life, helping him realize he's "more than a football player."  He described their wedding day as the most significant event, even surpassing career milestones.  The couple actively supports each other's demanding careers, demonstrating a strong partnership built on shared values and personal growth.

title: Not just cholesterol: This overlooked blood test can signal stroke risk
content: High homocysteine levels pose a serious risk to heart health and brain function. This often-ignored amino acid can damage blood vessels and lead to blood clots. Research indicates levels above 15 ¬µmol/L are classified as elevated and are associated with an increased risk of ischemic stroke and other vascular events.

title: Gabrielle Union celebrates father‚Äôs 81st birthday amid his life-threatening illness
content: Gabrielle Union celebrated her father's 81st birthday with a heartfelt Instagram message, expressing gratitude for their connection despite his ongoing battle with dementia. She shared touching moments, including his joy at seeing her and Dwyane Wade. Their daughter Kaavia also posted a touching tribute to her grandpa with an emotional post reflecting back to the time when she held his arms for first time.

title: Ayesha Curry sparks outrage for flaunting luxury life after ‚Äò9 to 5‚Äô remark
content: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, is facing backlash from fans after a recent Instagram post featuring her playing golf with friends. Critics have accused her of not appreciating her husband and her life, stemming from previous comments on a podcast where she revealed she hadn't initially wanted marriage or children.

title: Gracie Hunt shares heartfelt moment with Derek Green as Chiefs bounce back
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt celebrated the team's recent win by sharing a heartfelt video on social media, showcasing her affection for her new boyfriend, Derek Green. The couple, who have known each other since childhood, reconnected in 2017 and are now publicly displaying their deep love for one another.

title: Ayesha Curry‚Äôs confession resurfaces: Why she once avoided dating athletes
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, faces online backlash for recent comments on the 'Call Her Daddy' podcast, where she revealed she never wanted children or marriage. This comes despite her past teenage rule of avoiding athletes, a stark contrast to her current life with the basketball legend and their four children.

title: Ashes: Leaked tapes, tax woes - The shocking fall of England‚Äôs WC-winning captain
content: England's assistant coach Paul Collingwood is reportedly out of the Ashes backroom team due to personal reasons, following a series of controversies. These include leaked explicit tapes, a strip club incident before a T20 World Cup match, and a recent ¬£196,000 tax bill from HMRC.

title: Why did Trump strain India-US ties? Ex-envoy makes shocking claim
content: Former US envoy Rahm Emanuel claims Donald Trump damaged US-India relations due to ego and alleged financial dealings with Pakistan. Emanuel stated Trump "threw away 40 years of meticulous strategic planning" by straining ties with India, a key counterweight to China. This, he argued, has benefited China strategically and economically.

title: Joe Burrow injury update: Bengals QB out vs Steelers after toe surgery
content: The Cincinnati Bengals face the Pittsburgh Steelers in a crucial AFC North game. Quarterback Joe Burrow is out with a toe injury. Backup quarterbacks Jake Browning and Joe Flacco will lead the offense. The Bengals will focus on the run game and short passes. The defense must pressure the Steelers' quarterback. Protecting the ball is key for the Bengals.

title: ‚ÄòHe can‚Äôt be 14‚Äô: Shastri reveals chat about teenager‚Äôs age; compares him to Sachin
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri lauded young batter Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, comparing him to a young Sachin Tendulkar and noting Matthew Hayden's disbelief at his age. Shastri emphasized the crucial next few years for the prodigy, stressing the need for guidance to handle high expectations and potential setbacks. He also advised playing red-ball cricket to refine technique and temperament.

title: ‚ÄòNot a gold buyer, but‚Äô: JPMorgan CEO sees 'semi-rational' in buying it; here's why
content: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon, a gold skeptic, now finds it 'semi-rational' to hold the yellow metal, acknowledging its potential to reach $10,000 in the current environment. Major banks like Goldman Sachs and HSBC have also raised their gold price forecasts, citing strong investor demand and central bank interest as key drivers for the precious metal's surge.

title: Prof Brian Cox explains origins of interstellar object 3I/ATLAS
content: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, a 7.5-billion-year-old visitor from the early galaxy, is offering scientists a rare glimpse into the universe's past. Professor Brian Cox marvels at humanity's progress, noting we now photograph such ancient objects from other planets, a stark contrast to just centuries ago when Earth's place in the cosmos was debated. Its unique composition and trajectory provide invaluable insights.

title: Friends over money! Varun‚Äôs heartfelt confession - 'I can‚Äôt wear a Rs 3 lakh watch'
content: Indian spinner Varun Chakravarthy revealed his internal conflict over spending on luxury items, stemming from a middle-class upbringing.  He confessed to feeling immense guilt over purchasing an expensive watch, believing the money could significantly improve others' lives for generations.  Chakravarthy also shared his discomfort wearing high-value items around friends still facing financial struggles, feeling it disrespectful.

title: Sovereign Gold Bonds craze: SGBs trade at huge premium; should investors opt for them?
content: Gold prices are soaring ahead of Diwali, driving investor interest in Sovereign Gold Bonds (SGBs) on the secondary market. Retail investors are paying significant premiums, up to 32% above current gold rates, for these government-issued securities. Experts caution that these elevated prices pose risks if gold values decline, especially with limited liquidity and no fresh SGB issuances.

title: 'Double standards': MEA slams UK sanctions on Indian firm; curbs over Russian oil
content: India has strongly rebuffed the UK's new sanctions on Russia's oil sector and Indian firms, asserting its commitment to energy security and warning against "double standards" in global trade. New Delhi reiterated its non-recognition of unilateral sanctions, emphasising the paramount importance of meeting citizens' basic energy needs. The UK's move targeted Russian oil exports and entities, including India's Nayara Energy.

title: 'Took the ball to my wedding': Chakravarthy on cricket obsession, architect dreams
content: Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy's deep-seated cricket obsession led him to carry a ball even to his wedding reception, a habit he claims is second nature.  A late bloomer who turned to YouTube for self-training, Varun has since achieved significant success, becoming a key bowler for India and in the Indian Premier Leauge for KKR.

title: Facial nerve damage: Symptoms to watch, causes and prevention tips
content: Facial paralysis, affecting one or both sides of the face, stems from facial nerve damage, causing weakness and movement loss. Bell's palsy is a common sudden cause, while strokes, infections, and tumours can lead to gradual onset. Prompt medical attention is crucial, especially with stroke symptoms, for timely diagnosis and better recovery.

title: Who are the Talibros? Meet the content creators braving Afghanistan
content: A new wave of social media provocateurs, dubbed "Talibros," are marketing Taliban-controlled Afghanistan as an offbeat travel destination. These content creators repackage the country as a contrarian experience, downplaying human rights abuses and presenting a distorted reality to their audiences. Their content blurs the lines between shock humor and propaganda, exploiting distrust in traditional media.

title: Women's WC: Healy's ton powers AUS's 10-wicket demolition of BAN; inch closer to semis
content: Alyssa Healy's second consecutive century, an unbeaten 113, powered Australia to a dominant 10-wicket victory over Bangladesh in the Women's ODI World Cup. Healy and Phoebe Litchfield (84*) chased down 199 with ease in just 24.5 overs. Bangladesh's Shobana Mostary top-scored with 66, but Australia's bowlers shared wickets to restrict them.

title: Donald Trump says PM Modi has committed to tapering off Russian oil purchases
content: President Donald Trump stated Prime Minister Narendra Modi assured him India is reducing Russian oil purchases. This move aims to help end the Russia-Ukraine war. Trump indicated the tapering would be gradual but completed soon. He also mentioned efforts to encourage China to stop buying Russian oil.

title: Fire and ICE: How Chicago is resisting Donald Trump's onslaught
content: Immigration enforcement has shifted to Chicago's streets during Trump's second term, with ICE agents questioning residents and targeting sanctuary city policies. This aggressive operation, aimed at intimidating local officials, has sparked widespread resistance from residents and civil rights groups, testing the limits of federal power.

title: Josh Simmons missing: Chiefs rookie‚Äôs unusual absence raises alarms across NFL
content: Kansas City Chiefs rookie left tackle Josh Simmons has mysteriously vanished from team activities, causing concern and speculation. After being listed questionable and then playing, he was absent for a recent game for "personal reasons," with coaches reportedly unaware of his whereabouts. The team is navigating the situation while fans and teammates express worry for the young player's well-being.

title: Kap's Cafe attacked again: Shots fired at Kapil's eatery in Canada - watch
content: Kapil Sharma's Surrey cafe faced its third shooting incident as gunmen fired multiple shots. The Lawrence Bishnoi gang, through an aide, claimed responsibility, warning the public and threatening further action in Mumbai if their message isn't heeded. Previous attacks also saw the gang taking credit, highlighting a pattern of targeting.

title: Pavel Durov‚Äôs fitness: 300 pushups, cold baths and his extreme workout routine
content: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov follows an extreme fitness regime, starting his day with 300 push-ups and squats, followed by intense gym sessions. He emphasizes self-discipline over physical gains, believing mental strength is paramount. Durov also utilizes extreme temperature therapy, including ice baths and traditional Banya sauna sessions, to enhance endurance and well-being.

title: Women's WC: 1.87 billion minutes consumed; IND vs PAK breaks viewership records
content: The ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 is shattering viewership records, with over 60 million tuning in for the first 13 matches, a five-fold increase. The India-Pakistan clash alone drew 28.4 million viewers, becoming the most-watched women's international cricket match ever. This surge in engagement signals a promising future for women's cricket.

title: 'No call': India rejects Trump's claim of speaking to PM Modi about buying Russian oil
content: External affairs ministry has denied any recent phone call between Prime Minister Modi and US President Trump. This clarification follows Trump's assertion that Modi had promised to halt Russian oil imports. The ministry emphasized that India's energy policy prioritizes national interests and consumer protection through diversified sourcing.

title: Four reasons the Dodgers look unbeatable this October
content: L.A. didn't enter the month as the juggernaut it was expected to be. Now, though, the Dodgers are playing like it.

title: Cignetti gets new 8-year, $93M deal at Indiana
content: Indiana announced a new eight-year contract with coach Curt Cignetti worth nearly $93 million on Thursday.

title: Source: Bengals' Hendrickson to be out for TNF
content: Bengals defensive end Trey Hendrickson (hip) is expected to be out Thursday night against the Steelers, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Thursday.

title: Bucks, Green agree to 4-year, $45M extension
content: Bucks guard AJ Green has agreed to a four-year, $45 million fully guaranteed contract extension with the franchise, agent Matt Bollero of ProMondo Sports told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Fanmio must pay Masvidal $5M+ for Diaz fight
content: Fanmio, an online entertainment platform, has been ordered to pay fighter Jorge Masvidal over $5 million for nonpayment of his contracted purse following his 2024 boxing match against fellow mixed martial artist Nate Diaz.

title: Hornets waive Dinwiddie 3 months after signing
content: The Charlotte Hornets have waived Spencer Dinwiddie, the team announced, just three months after signing the veteran guard during free agency.

title: Chicago to host 2026 WNBA All-Star Game
content: The 2026 WNBA All-Star Game will be played at Chicago's United Center on Saturday, July 25, the league announced Thursday.

title: Goalie Hart joining Golden Knights after acquittal
content: Should the Golden Knights sign goalie Carter Hart to a contract, he will be eligible to begin playing in the NHL on Dec. 1.

title: McMahon to enter program for reckless driving
content: Former WWE CEO Vince McMahon has been allowed to enter a pretrial program to resolve a reckless driving charge stemming from an accident this summer in Connecticut.

title: Harry Kane is tearing up the Bundesliga at Bayern Munich. What's next for England's No. 9?
content: Kane has always been an elite goal scorer, but in his third season with Bayern Munich, he has taken his game to a whole new level.

content: Amorim has leaned more on Mount this season, and Mount is showing just what this club has been missing.

content: As an Oct. 20 deadline looms, here's everything you need to know about the biggest potential NBA rookie contract extension decisions that have yet to unfold.

content: Ranking every young star in the NWSL, ages 19 and under: Which women's soccer players topped our teens list?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Dortmund center back Nico Schlotterbeck
content: Liverpool are prepared to pursue Borussia Dortmund center back Nico Schlotterbeck. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Talent, emotional intelligence and a lifetime of sacrifice have made Oscar Piastri a F1 title favorite
content: There's no doubting Oscar Piastri's talent, but what's set him apart in his F1 title quest is his ability to control his emotions.

title: Bubba Wallace's son has helped turn his dad's NASCAR career (and life) around
content: Bubba Wallace used to find little enjoyment at the racetrack, starved for NASCAR success. Since the birth of his son, though, that has all changed.

title: Experts identify one player they feel differently about compared with common narrative
content: Our experts identify one player they feel differently about compared to the common narrative heading into the NBA season.

title: Ukrainian Drone Kills Russian State Media Correspondent
content: A Russian state media correspondent was killed in a Ukrainian drone strike in the Moscow-occupied part of Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia region, his outlet, the news agency RIA Novosti, said Thursday.

title: Trump Threatens To "Go In And Kill" Hamas If Gaza Killings Continue
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday warned Hamas "we will have no choice but to go in and kill them" if internal bloodshed persists in Gaza.

title: UP Woman Arrested For Marrying Multiple Men, Fleeing With Cash, Jewellery
content: Rajasthan Police have arrested a woman in Gurugram for allegedly marrying multiple men and fleeing with their jewellery and money, officials said.

title: 'Mega Extortion': HD Kumaraswamy Slams Bengaluru Property Conversion Scheme
content: Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy has strongly criticised the Karnataka government's newly announced B-Khata to A-Khata conversion scheme in Bengaluru, questioning its affordability for ordinary citizens.

title: Bihar Opposition Dodges Bullet As Key Ally Agrees To Settle For 15 Seats
content: Mukesh Sahani's Vikasheel Insaan Party (VIP) has agreed to contest in 15 seats in the Bihar assembly election, ending the suspense over the coalition's final shape just weeks before voting begins.

title: After 'Frank' Call, Kremlin To 'Immediately' Start Trump-Putin Meet Prep
content: The Kremlin said on Thursday it would "immediately" start preparing a summit between Russian and US presidents after Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump held an "extremely frank and trustful" phone call.

title: No Phone Call Between PM, Trump: India On US President's Oil Claim
content: India on Thursday firmly denied claims made by US President Donald Trump that he had a recent telephonic conversation with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during which, he alleges, the PM "assured" him India would cease purchasing oil from Russia.

title: Video: Liquor Bottles Hidden Under Toilet Commode In 'Dry' Bihar, 1 Arrested
content: Police seized large quantities of liquor, found hidden inside the toilet tank of a house in poll-bound Bihar's Nawada district.

title: J&K Revives 150-Year-Old Tradition Of Shifting Capital Between Srinagar, Jammu
content: The 150-year-old Darbar Move, the biannual tradition of shifting the Jammu and Kashmir capital between Srinagar and Jammu, has been restored, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah announced today as he completed one year in office.

title: Bhojpuri Actor-Singer Khesari Lal Yadav, Wife Chanda Join RJD
content: Bhojpuri superstar Khesari Lal Yadav, one of the best-known singers and actors in the most popular dialect of Bihar and eastern Uttar Pradesh, on Thursday joined the RJD.

title: 2 Years After Titan Submersible Implosion, Report Claims This Caused It
content: The implosion of the OceanGate's Titan submersible on its way to the Titanic wreck in June 2023 was caused by faulty engineering and multiple failures to test the vessel, according to an official report.

title: Assam Seeks Fast-Track Trial In Zubeen Garg Death Case, Cops To Visit Singapore
content: In a significant move in the investigation into the death of Assam's cultural icon Zubeen Garg, the state government has decided to push for a fast-track court for trial in the case.

title: Bengaluru Student Headed For Exam Approached From Behind, Throat Slit
content: In a shocking incident, a 21-year-old college student was brutally murdered in broad daylight near the Srirampura railway track in Bengaluru earlier today.

title: Poll Body Defends Identity Verification Of Burqa-Clad Voters In Bihar Polls
content: Amid demands that the Election Commission withdraw its direction to verify identity of burqa-clad women at Bihar's polling stations, the EC defended its move saying it is implementing a decision taken as back as 1994.

title: Video: Cops Watching, Delhi University Student Slaps Professor
content: A professor at Delhi University's Dr Bhim Rao Ambedkar College was slapped and assaulted during a heated altercation involving Delhi University Students' Union (DUSU) joint secretary Deepika Jha and other members of the ABVP.

title: Congress Releases First List For Bihar, State Chief To Contest From Kutumba
content: The chief of the Bihar Congress party will contest from Kutumba seat, according to the first list of 48 candidates announced by the party today.

title: Rs 5 Crore Cash, Mercedes, Audi: Stunning Seizure From IPS Officer's House
content: The CBI has arrested a senior Indian Police Service (IPS) officer posted as Deputy Inspector General (DIG), Ropar Range in Punjab, in a corruption case that began with an alleged demand for Rs 8 lakh.

title: Rare Earths Tensions Rise As US, China Trade Barbs
content: Chinese state media issued a seven-point rebuttal to US calls for Beijing to wind back its rare earth controls, as both sides struggle to move beyond a volley of barbs and accusations of blindsiding the other.

title: The World Cant Quit Fossil Fuels That Easily. Here's Why
content: Fossil fuels still power much of the world, even though renewable energy has become cheaper in most places and avoids both pollution and the climate damage caused by burning coal, oil and natural gas.

title: "Great Progress": After Call, Trump Says He Will Meet Putin In Budapest
content: President Donald Trump said Thursday he will meet again with Russia's Vladimir Putin in an effort to end the war in Ukraine. A date has not been set, but Trump wrote on social media that the meeting would take place in Budapest, Hungary.

content: The WBPCC‚Äôs memorandum listed out 16-point demands like the inclusion of electoral rolls since 2002 till that of the Assembly election in 2021 as probative evidence of eligibility and citizenship of a voter¬†

content: Kochi Corporation and 13 municipalities in Ernakulam¬†achieve total coverage of 96% and 85% respectively in deployment of volunteers

content: High Court orders competent authority at the Centre to hold talks with State Environment Secretary to find a viable solution to pollution of the river, including identifying an alternative site for effluent treatment

content: The U.S. president claimed that while India may not be able to cut the procurement immediately, the process has started.

content: He attends a series of high-level meetings and discusses areas of interest with CEOs of Fuchs Design AG and FyrstGen

content: The ripple effect of traffic from the Outer Ring Road, coupled with narrow lanes, has become a major concern for commuters on connecting roads, particularly for school buses, as vehicles crawl along these stretches every day during peak hours

content: In a post on X, he specially appreciated IT Minister Nara Lokesh for organising the campaign that deepened the understanding of reforms among youth

title: Abujhmad, North Bastar regions free of Maoists: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister says 258 cadres surrendered in two days; government aiming to ‚Äúdecimate Naxalism before the 31st of March 2026‚Äù

title: Chhattisgarh High Court upholds cancellation of forest rights of villagers in Hasdeo Arand forest where Adani runs coal mines
content: A Single Bench of Justice Rakesh Mohan Pandey stated that granting the community forest rights in itself was a ‚Äúmistake‚Äù that was ‚Äúrectified‚Äù through the cancellation, concluding that this made the order granting the rights ‚Äúvoid ab initio‚Äù

title: Kochi school may approach HC against ‚Äòadverse‚Äô findings in DDE‚Äôs report in Hijab row
content: The Parent Teacher Association president says the management has entrusted its counsel to check the legal recourse to be adopted as the report had falsely claimed that the school authorities had stopped the student from attending the classes after her parents insisted on wearing hijab

title: Karnataka Cabinet approves Bengaluru Business Corridor to connect Electronic City with Mysuru, Tumakuru roads
content: The 117 km tolled corridor will be developed by BDA in two years by giving five options of compensation for land-losers

title: Andhra Pradesh receives ‚Äònormal‚Äô rainfall during Southwest Monsoon
content: Between June 1 and September 30 this year, the State received 530.9 mm rainfall, which is higher than the normal of 521.6 mm, but is the second lowest in the past five years, according to the India Meteorological Department in Amaravati

title: HAL‚Äôs third LCA Tejas production line in Nashik boosts India‚Äôs indigenous aerospace capabilities
content: HAL‚Äôs 13 lakh sq.ft. facility in Nashik will have the capacity to manufacture eight Tejas Mk1A aircraft per year, allowing for expedited deliveries to the IAF

title: Delegation submits memorandum to CM seeking to extend Sabari Rail to Vizhinjam
content: Proposal envisages connecting Sabari Rail to Vizhinjam port via Nedumangad by developing Kattakada, Nedumangad, Venjaramoodu and Kilimanoor as suburbs of Thiruvananthapuram

title: Genco complains about low quality coal supplies from Singareni
content: CMD of Genco writes to his SCCL counterparts stating that low grade coal is affecting generating units‚Äô performance, resulting in revenue loss

title: Young JSP supporter electrocuted at PM Modi‚Äôs meeting venue in Kurnool
content: The accident took place when the flagpole the youth was carrying came in contact with overhead power line

title: Tejashwi has Italian pistol, deputy CMs own rifle, revolver, say poll affidavits
content: Tejashwi Yadav and his family have total assets worth ‚Çπ8.98 crore; JD(U) leader Anant Singh has declared total assets of ‚Çπ37.88 crore, the former don has 28 criminal cases pending against him

title: Manikanth Rathod says Priyank Kharge should tender apology for RSS ban statement
content: He questions the language Priyank Kharge uses for Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah

title: Administrative reforms commission recommends closure of seven boards and corporations, and merger of nine others
content: Amid the ongoing process of political appointments to various boards and corporations, the Karnataka Administrative Reforms Commission-2 has recommended closure of seven bodies and merger of nine others with those with overlapping functions

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu predicts NDA victory in Bihar
content: The 21st century belongs to Modi and his victory march should continue for ensuring Viksit Bharat, he says

title: Bengaluru to likely get Namo Bharat trains to boost regional connectivity
content: A team of Karnataka officials recently visited the NCRTC headquarters in New Delhi to hold preliminary discussions on the project‚Äôs feasibility, alignment, and technical design

title: Watch: Why Tamil Nadu is removing caste names from streets, villages, and schools | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: In Tamil Nadu, streets are being renamed, colonies removed from records, and institutions stripped of caste-linked titles. But this isn‚Äôt just about changing labels ‚Äî it‚Äôs about power, memory, and a society trying to dismantle centuries of caste discrimination. The question is: can changing names really challenge entrenched caste power?

title: Govt. decision to withdraw tourist restrictions at Idukki dam welcomed
content: Minister Roshy Augustine says the decision was taken at a recent meeting in Thiruvananthapuram with Electricity Minister K. Krishnankutty. During the meeting, the latter urged the lifting of tourist restrictions at the dam, enabling tourists to walk across it

title: Government has launched a witch-hunt against Shafi Parambil, alleges KPCC president
content: He says CPI(M) has been vengeful towards Shafi ever since they lost the Vadakara Lok Sabha constituency to him

title: Four booked for allegedly assaulting, urinating on a man from SC community in Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Katni
content: Victim alleged attack followed dispute over use of illegally mined gravel for Panchayat office construction; police register cross-complaints

title: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan and IT Minister Lokesh heap praise on Prime Minister Modi
content: Calling Modi a ‚Äòkarma yogi‚Äô, Pawan says NDA should be at the helm for next 15 years, while Lokesh observes that with Namo in Delhi and CBN in Andhra, it is a double-engine bullet train government

title: Bathymetric survey to measure the depth of lakes as part of HMDA Master Plan
content: HMDA will prepare base map for its extended purview of 11,500 square kilometres, which includes the areas of Future City Development Authority (762 square kilometres) and also the Yadadri Temple Development Authority (98 square kilometres)

title: Contempt plea against Mamata withdrawn in Bengal teacher recruitment case after Attorney General refuses consent
content: Aatmadeep, a charitable trust, had accused the West Bengal CM of committing contempt of court over her remarks against the judgment delivered by the Supreme Court earlier this year

title: Move to relocate women‚Äôs jail in Thiruvananthapuram sparks concern
content: Govt. decides to shift the women inmates to the Poojappura Central Prison so as to free up the space in Attakulangara for the Central Prison inmates, which is overcrowded. Prisoners, jail officials concerned about lack of facilities for women at Poojappura. Move temporary till a new Central Prison comes up, says Director General of Prisons

title: Trump claims Modi assured India will taper Russian oil buy; MEA 'unaware' of conversation
content: foreign affairs ministry in Delhi denies knowledge of any such conversation . he said he was assured by PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday that new Delhi was tapering its purchase of Russian oil to help stop the Russia-Ukraine war .

title: RS poll: NC reaches out to Mufti for support; PDP links backing to ‚Äòanti-bulldozer‚Äô bill
content: mehbooba asked for support for the governing party‚Äôs candidate for one of four seats that his ally Congress chose not to contest . the 'anti-bulldozer' bill to stop evictions and to regularise the land of those who have been in continuous possession for 30 years .

title: 2026 class rankings: Missouri makes move with fall signings
content: the 2026 recruiting class remains in the top 25 after the dismissal of James Franklin . programs including Arkansas, UCLA and Oklahoma State have seen their classes fall apart in the wake of coaching changes . with overall success on the field, Missouri is starting to build success on a recruiting trail as well, with multiple commitments in October .

title: LCS Day 5: Will Blue Jays even the ALCS? Can Brewers stay off NLCS brink?

title: Fowler and Graziano: Intel on Eagles and 49ers ahead of Week 7, plus looming trades

title: Vintage duel: Joe Flacco vs. Aaron Rodgers is a historic battle of QBs 40 and older
content: the two starting quarterbacks have a rare opportunity to keep playing at an advanced age . they will be just the second quarterback pairing in the Super Bowl era to start against each other . the two quarterbacks will be the second in the super bowl to start each other as 40-year-ol .

title: 10 players to put on your radar the rest of the season
content: Matt Bowen details why fantasy managers should keep an eye on Pat Bryant . it could be a rarely-used wide receiver making an impact play or a No. 2 tight end finding the end zone . create or join a fantasy basketball league on ESPN. Your championship run starts today! Sign up today!

title: Women's College Volleyball Bracketology: 2025 NCAA tournament predictions, bubble watch
content: the field of 64 is revealed on Nov. 30 (6 p.m. ET, ESPN) there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the rest of the bracket is filled out to balance it competitively and geographically .

title: WNBA mock draft: Betts, Fudd or Miles at No. 1?
content: the WNBA is negotiating a new collective bargaining agreement with the union . the draft lottery, expansion drafts for Toronto and Portland and a mammoth free agency will have to take place before the 2026 draft . five of our top six selections in this mock were eligible to go in the 2025 draft, but all opted to return for a return trip .
